clinical_summary: Patient presents with chronic low back pain and left-sided radiculopathy persisting for over 3 months. Conservative therapy including physical therapy and NSAIDs for 8 weeks has failed to provide adequate relief. MRI of the lumbar spine is medically necessary to evaluate for underlying structural pathology.

supporting_evidence.evidence: Chronic low back pain with radiculopathy documented in clinical notes.
Physical therapy and NSAIDs administered for 8 weeks without adequate improvement.

supporting_evidence.criterion_label: Neurological deficit or red flag present
supporting_evidence.evidence: Progressive numbness in left lower extremity reported and documented.
No prior lumbar MRI found in patient record.
Ordering physician is board-certified in relevant specialty.
